page.title: 01Introduction to the Lexhams
page.content: The land throughout this area is gently undulating, and a main feature of the{landscape}is fields containing crops.A full variety of cereal crops is grown and because of intensive crop rotation the appearance of the fields regularly changes.The number of landowners in the area is few as large acreages are farmed as one unit. Passing through the centre of the {landscape}is the River Nar which has it's source nearby.At one point in the area a man made lake has been formed from the river.Much{housing}is quite old and flint construction is a regularly observed feature.There are two types of{religion}represented in the area by a chapel and a church dating from{Saxon}times.
